reviews.review:
Nicely made game with beautiful maps that will challenge you. It also has awesome music and an interesting story, especially if you played the first Portal game.

Steve merchant also does some incredibly amusing voice acting in this game.
If you don't own this game, you're doing it wrong.
Кто не прошел - тот тухлое яйцо!
Follow's on from the original game with great humour and more mind benders. More content than the original game and a multiplayer feature I've yet to try out.
I'm in spaaaaaaaace...GOTY 2011
ist gut ...
전작보다한수십배는 더재밌음 가격이안아까울정도로재밌음

Valve pulled it once more and Portal 2 is again superb puzzle game. The game mechanics are expanded with new elements, the size of many puzzle-levels is trully immense and the game is significantly longer than the first one.

Also, the story of Portal 2 isn't just a very nice addition to the puzzles like in the first game, but now it is an integral part of the game. Dare I say it's even more enjoyable then the puzzles themself and the epic finale will resonate in your mind for quite some time!

But the most defining aspect of Portal 2 are two hilarious AI companions who are responsible for your constant giggling throughout the game. And both of them are also murderous psychopats...

Moreover, you get a multiplayer! Puzzles in a multiplayer mode are generaly harder, but two heads are (usually) smarter than one, so you should be able to solve everything. At least we were ;-) Multiplayer campaign isn't very long, but it's a great addition to the game and it works flawlessly replacing humour and storytelling with comradeship and sense of belonging (or more likely enmity and hatred after a few failed attempts of solving some harder levels).

Only reason I won't give Portal 2 better rating then to the original is the fact that I feel like the puzzles aren't as inventive and fun like they were in first game and they get a bit repetitive over time. Or you can say I am no fan of gels, I guess... But it may also be just because the game is quite long and it was probably impossible to make all levels completely different from each other.

P.S.: There isn't any cake again! But this time you can try to bake your very own, or even try some of miriads of community-created recipes (mods and maps) with your friends :-)

[b] Rating: 9.5/10 [/b]
мазафака, эта игра вполне  себе кошерна, но мультиплей обязывает играть именно с корешем, потому что часто вам подбирают в напарники всяких бичей.
Engaging puzzles and great storyline, i dont see how i couldn't reccomend it!
It's awesome.
SPAAACE!

If you thought Portal was good, then you will absolutely love Portal 2.  A magnificent game and a must-buy title.

portal 1 > portal 2 but still a great game!

If you haven't heard all the hype from Portal 2, WHAT'S WRONG WITH YOU?! This game is great in every sense of the word. It far exceeds the first one on so many levels, and I want to be clear I LOVED the first one. There's more puzzles, and they're harder too. The sorry is even better, revealing more about the history of Aperture Science. And the comedy is gold. If you don't already have this game, GET IT! You most certainly won't be disappointed.
Потрясающая игра с интересным сюжетом, замечательными персонажами, первоклассным юмором и революционным мультиплеером. Обязательна к прохождению!!!
Um dos melhores jogos que já joguei. Qualquer outra informação é spoiler.

Portal was an interesting experiment, but this one is far more than a perfect game. Everything is better: the story is longer, full of amazing dialogues, the new gameplay elements fit greatly in the portal mechanics, and the co-op campaign is like the best multiplayer game ever made.
Well done Valve!
Best co-op I've played. Love it.

Great continuation to the original with an intriquing plotline that makes you want to keep testing indefinitely. Perfect balance of sarcasm and wit  with a touch of uk influence. Awfully good :D

The biggest first-person action series of all time and the follow-up to last year’s blockbuster Portal returns with Portal 2..

Portal 2 will take you behind enemy lines as a member of an elite special forces unit engaging in covert warfare, classified operations, and explosive conflicts across the globe. With access to exclusive weaponry and equipment, your actions will tip the balance during the most dangerous time period mankind has ever known.

I missed all the excitment of the first Protal, and after totally beating this game, I regretted it so much,  I went back and started playing the first one as well!  Portal 2 is just, amazing.  There are fantastic puzzles to solve, and it marrys this with witty humor and an engrossing story-line.  The voice acting is just over the top for a FPS, and this really looks like a kick start to a full length feature film by Pixar or something.  Just a fun game to play, or watch played.  "If you need to go the bathroom in this next series of tests, please let test associates know. Because in all likelihood, whatever comes out of you is going to be coal. Only temporary, so do not worry. If it persists for a week though, start worrying and come see us, because that's not supposed to happen." --Cave Johnson

- Game of the Year 2011 -

I have played the Portal Franchise since I was a young kid and I'm still addicted to this game 10 years since then!

The game doesn't age, has plenty of re-playability thanks to PTI (Perpetual Testing Initiative) and just great story. Even the graphics don't look dated!

I heavily encourage anyway who hasn't played Portal 1 and 2 to play them, best games of the decade.

Wow. Just wow. Everything about Portal 1 that you loved, but times 1000.

Everything is just flawless. Music, visuals, characters, voices, gameplay mechanics, levels, story, progression, humor, emotion.

All there in spades and this may be Valve's finest work to date.

However, one thing is missing: Twitch/speed puzzles. I sorely miss those, otherwise, one of the best games I've played to date.
Not as good as the first, but then not much is. Longer and more complex though, which makes it a good sequel, and the humour is still intact if less distilled. A very, very good game.

More story driven than the first one, but the story follows a formula reminiscent  of that of a Pixar film, making it pretty freakin' funny.  Gameplay has almost been quadrupled  as compared to the first Portal, plus there's a co-op campaign.

Good sequel to a great game. I can't say I was bedazzled by Portal 2 since the core fundamentals haven't changed from the original game, but there are a few new elements which introduce some cool twists to the puzzles. The ending was indeed lunacy--WOW. Without giving anything away, it is simply an ending worth experiencing. The coop is great fun too. If you enjoyed the first Portal, playing this one is a no-brainer--it is very much the same, only better.
Отличный сиквел знаменитого шедевра, одинаково интересный как опытным игрокам, так и новичкам, только познакомившимся с индустрией компьютерных развлечений.
Grandisimo juego, tanto la campaña/historia como su modo cooperativo.

Definitly one of the best games of 2011.

If you're not familiar with the game, it is a puzzle game, played in a first person perspective, where you use portals to solve the puzzles, while immersed in a storyline with some of the best voice acting I've ever seen.

Absolutly recomended if you like puzzle games, and dark sarcastic humour.

if you're the sort of person who thinks a puzzle game could be worthy of the highest score in the same way that a game in another genre would be worthy, then this game gets a 10/10

on the other hand, if you think puzzle games aren't worthy of the highest review scores because of the fact that they're, well,  'just puzzle games', then this game still gets at least 9/10... unless of course you think that any great 'FPS' has to include deathmatch, perks, and guitar riffs after you get kills... in that case, you might give this game 1/10

This game recaptures the logical puzzles and hysterical malevolence of GLADOS that made the first Portal so much fun to play.  New gizmos to play with, new rooms to crack, and the ability to work with a partner.  Play this game.

Yet to play 2-player mode, but Stephen Merchant's commentary is priceless. Karl Pilkington might have made a cool dysfunctional sentrybot voice. C'est la vie.

The backstory revealed in this game is something epic and Cave Johnson is hilarious. 

Not great if you don't like First-person perspective. I had to play in small doses to avoid feeling nauseated, a trick learned from the original Portal.

Portal, simply one of the coolest games ever made. Wicked concept, clever level design, great storytelling, engrossing gameplay. The sequal to that game leaves little to improve upon. Co-op mode is a very nice addition.

К тому же, здесь шикарный мультиплеер на двоих. Попробуйте убрать платформу из под ног вашего товарища, когда он бежит над пропастью с кубиком в руках, услышите о себе много нового и интересного!

Utterly brilliant, probably Valve's finest effort to date.  Everything about the game works - the art, the humor, the voice actors, the levels, the story.  The only complaint I have is that more modifiers weren't added to later levels to crank up the craziness, but from a storytelling/gameplay/inclusive of all potential players perspective I don't see how it could have been done better.
